div.p:
Forty University of Maryland students attempted sit-ins Sat­urday at five College Park area restaurants. There were no ar
­ rests.

The students, members of CORE, were served without in­
cident at Ledo’s Restaurant and the Federal Diner, but were re­
fused service at Jimmy Comb­er’s, the College Inn,and the Olde Dutch Inn. A few non-stu­
dents demonstrated with the group.
Nineteen white and Negro students sat in the main dining room of Jimmy Comber’s four hours while small, rotating groups picketed outside on the sidewalk facing University Boulevard.

The picketers marched, brac­
ing against the wind, singing “Woke up this morning with my mind set on freedom.” They bore placards reading “Make the Free State Free for All,” and "“Service for All Citizens.” Inside the restaurant, Jimmy Comber told Diamondback re­
porters, “I don’t mind serving colored people. I don’t care one way or another; but I think my clientele would mind, so I don’t serve them.

“I wish the state of Mary­ land would pass a law requir­
ing equal service so that I could serve everyone without objection from my regular customers.”

Two men walked into the res­
taurant and offered to bring in dogs to “clean out the place.” Comber ordered them off the premises.

At 3 p.m. the sit-inners left en masse accompanied by de­
risive applause from the patrons of the restaurant. A smaller group of demon­strators was locked out of the College Inn on Route 1 before they could gain entrance. They were ordered off the premises by county police and not allow­
ed to picket because the Inn's property extended to Route 1. Another group was locked out of Terrapin Inn.

Six students were refused service at Ye Olde Dutch Inn in Riverdale. The waitress told them that it was not the res­
taurant’s policy to serve mixed groups. The group read the fourteenth amendment to the manager and left.

Marvin A.Raps, president of the Prince George's County CORE, called the demonstra­
tions “very effective.”

Raps is a graduate student at Maryland. He was arrested on Jan. 27 at a sit-in at Park Col­
lege Diner. The case was thrown out.
